resources.string: If you are new, tap below to start your profile.
Tap below to view your BMI information.
Please select the profile name you wish to view.
To delete an old or unwanted profile, select the profile name, then tap below.
To update a profile, select the profile name, then tap below.
Let\'s begin by setting up your profile…

string-array.name: gender_array

Male
Female
Other

resources.string: Tap below to view your profile
Tap below to return to main screen.
To learn more about BMI indices, tap below.
BMI Reference Chart and Improvement Tips
A person\'s Body Mass Index (BMI) is calculated based on their height and weight, and can help determine which weight category an individual may fall under.
Children (2-19): Below the 5th Percentile.\n Adults: Underweight Category.
Children (2-19): 5th - 85th Percentiles.\n Adults: Normal Weight Category.
Children (2-19): Within or above the 95th Percentile.\n Adults: Obese Category.
Adults: Morbidly or Extreme Obese category.

string-array.name: improvement_suggestions
string-array.item: try to check in with yourself, do you feel healthy.
Walk 15 minutes a day.
Eat ample fruits and vegetables with your meals.
Making sure you eat a balanced meal.
Stretch for 10 minutes each hour.
Do 10 push-ups, 10 squats, and 10 sit-ups before the day\'s end.
Drinking water
Jogging for 10 minutes
Learning to do a front flip
Checking with a dietitian
Doing 10 push ups
getting a physical from a doctor
Research & hire a personal trainer
Pokemon Go
Becoming a walking postman
finding encouraging ways to exercise
Jumping-Jacks for 10 minutes
Push ups for 10 minutes
Finding a sport you enjoy doing
Plotting revenge by getting buff
taking your pet for a walk twice a day
Participating in a local charity marathon
Engaging in politics, specifically with someone against you
Going on a mission
Not ordering from that fast food place… you know the one
Jogging for 10 minutes

string-array.name: quotes
string-array.item:
"Success is not final,

failure is not fatal:

it is the courage

to continue that counts."
 - Winston Churchill

"Never bend your head.

Always hold it high.

Look the world

straight in the eye."
 - Helen Keller

\"Believe you can and\n
you\'re halfway there.\"\n - Theodore Roosevelt

"Life is like riding a bicycle.

To keep your balance,

you must keep moving."
 - Albert Einstein

"Nothing is impossible.

The word itself says

I'm possible."
 - Audrey Hepburn

"You are never too old

to set another goal or

to dream a new dream."
 - C.S. Lewis

"Sometimes you will never know

the value of a moment,

until it becomes a memory."
 - Dr. Seuss

\"You must do the things\n
you think you cannot do.\"\n - Eleanor Roosevelt

\"Be the change that you\n
wish to see in the world.\"\n - Mahatma Gandhi

"Let us make our Future now,

and let us make our dreams

tomorrow's reality."
 - Malala Yousafzai

"If I cannot do great things,

I can do small things

in a great way."
 - Martin Luther King Jr.

\"Spread love\n
everywhere you go.\"\n - Mother Teresa

"The best way to get started

is to quit talking

and begin doing."
 - Walt Disney

"The only limit to our

realization of tomorrow

will be our doubts of today."
 - Franklin D. Roosevelt

"Memories of our lives,

of our works and our deeds

will continue in others."
 - Rosa Parks

"How wonderful it is that

nobody need wait a single

moment before starting

to improve the world."
 - Anne Frank

"The best way to cheer

yourself up is to try to

cheer somebody else up."
 - Mark Twain

\"It is better to offer\n
no excuse then a bad one.\"\n - George Washington
